articleData.blog_content:
It all started in mid February 2019 when there was a workshop going on in KIIT. I was in the workshop where I came to know that a recruitment drive was going on in Desire Foundation. That was the last day of the recruitment and I was already running late for the interview. It is said somethings are meant to happen and becoming a part of Desire Foundation was the same. I would have missed the chance if some of my friends had not informed me about the recruitment drive. I gave the interview for Content Writer and had a mixed feeling of whether they would select me or not. Two days later I received a call where I was being welcomed to the Desire family.

Not just I gained experience here but I also made wonderful memories which made me believe why this isn't just a usual KIIT society but a Family. Each slum visit, each school visit has taught me how important education is and how lucky I am to get a chance to be a part of someone's journey from home to school. I remember how last diwali was different from all the diwalis at home or at hostel. Even today I get goosebumps when I try to remember that diwali day when those little kids smiled for a while because of us.

My journey in KIIT might end in a few months but the chapters I wrote as a part of Desire Family has a big part in my life's story.

"Hum Rahe Ya Na Rahe
Yaad Aayenge Yeh Pal"
